oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Confederate currency bills
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Confederate paper money in $20, $10, and $5 denominations, printed in Richmond, February 17th, 1864. The $20 bill shows an image of the Tennessee State Capitol. All are esssentially promissory notes, pledging to pay bearer the requisite amount of hard currency "two years after the ratification of a treaty of peace between the Confederate States and the United States of America."
